step.text: Right, because $x^2$ is always nonnegative. What if $x<0$?
previous_steps: So $f(x)=x|x|$ and we want to find $f^{-1}(4)$.
That means we want to find the $x$ value that results in $f(x)=4$.
So we want to find an $x$ such that $x|x|=4$.
So $f(x)=x|x|$ and we want to find $f^{-1}(-100)$.
That means we want to find the $x$ value that results in $f(x)=-100$.
So we want to find an $x$ such that $x|x|=-100$.
